DeleteLink(Object, String, Object)
DeleteLink(Object, String, Object)

Changes the state of the link to deleted in the list of links being tracked by the System.Data.Services.Client.DataServiceContext. Remarks: Notifies the context that a link exists between the source and target object and that the link is represented via the source.sourceProperty which is a collection. The context adds this link to the set of deleted links to be sent to the data service on the next call to SaveChanges(). If the specified link exists in the "Added" state, then the link is detached (see DetachLink method) instead.

DeleteObject(Object)
DeleteObject(Object)

Changes the state of the specified object to be deleted in the System.Data.Services.Client.DataServiceContext. Remarks: Existing objects in the Added state become detached.

LoadProperty(Object, String)
LoadProperty(Object, String)

Loads deferred content for a specified property from the data service.Not supported by the WCF Data Services 5.0 client for Silverlight. Remarks: If entity is in in detached or added state, this method will throw an InvalidOperationException since there is nothing it can load from the server. If entity is in unchanged or modified state, this method will load its collection or reference elements as unchanged with unchanged bindings. If entity is in deleted state, this method will load the entities linked to by its collection or reference property in the unchanged state with bindings in the deleted state.

SaveChangesAsync(Object)
SaveChangesAsync(Object)

SetLink(Object, String, Object)
SetLink(Object, String, Object)

Notifies the System.Data.Services.Client.DataServiceContext that a new link exists between the objects specified and that the link is represented by the property specified by the sourceProperty parameter. Remarks: Notifies the context that a modified link exists between the source and target objects and that the link is represented via the source.sourceProperty which is a reference. The context adds this link to the set of modified created links to be sent to the data service on the next call to SaveChanges(). Links are one way relationships. If a back pointer exists (ie. two way association), this method should be called a second time to notify the context object of the second link.

UpdateObject(Object)
UpdateObject(Object)

Changes the state of the specified object in the System.Data.Services.Client.DataServiceContext to System.Data.Services.Client.EntityStates.Modified.

    DeleteLink(Object, String, Object)
    DeleteLink(Object, String, Object)

    Changes the state of the link to deleted in the list of links being tracked by the System.Data.Services.Client.DataServiceContext. Remarks: Notifies the context that a link exists between the source and target object and that the link is represented via the source.sourceProperty which is a collection. The context adds this link to the set of deleted links to be sent to the data service on the next call to SaveChanges(). If the specified link exists in the "Added" state, then the link is detached (see DetachLink method) instead. 

    void DeleteLink(object source, string sourceProperty, object target)Sub DeleteLink(source As Object, sourceProperty As String, target As Object)

    Parameters

    • source
      Object
      Object

      The source object in the link to be marked for deletion.

    • sourceProperty
      String
      String

      The name of the navigation property on the source object that is used to access the target object.

    • target
      Object
      Object

      The target object involved in the link that is bound to the source object. The target object must be of the type identified by the source property or a subtype.

    LoadProperty(Object, String)
    LoadProperty(Object, String)

    Loads deferred content for a specified property from the data service.Not supported by the WCF Data Services 5.0 client for Silverlight. Remarks: If entity is in in detached or added state, this method will throw an InvalidOperationException since there is nothing it can load from the server. If entity is in unchanged or modified state, this method will load its collection or reference elements as unchanged with unchanged bindings. If entity is in deleted state, this method will load the entities linked to by its collection or reference property in the unchanged state with bindings in the deleted state.

    QueryOperationResponse LoadProperty(object entity, string propertyName)Function LoadProperty(entity As Object, propertyName As String) As QueryOperationResponse

    SetLink(Object, String, Object)
    SetLink(Object, String, Object)

    Notifies the System.Data.Services.Client.DataServiceContext that a new link exists between the objects specified and that the link is represented by the property specified by the sourceProperty parameter. Remarks: Notifies the context that a modified link exists between the source and target objects and that the link is represented via the source.sourceProperty which is a reference. The context adds this link to the set of modified created links to be sent to the data service on the next call to SaveChanges(). Links are one way relationships. If a back pointer exists (ie. two way association), this method should be called a second time to notify the context object of the second link. 

    void SetLink(object source, string sourceProperty, object target)Sub SetLink(source As Object, sourceProperty As String, target As Object)

    Parameters

    • source
      Object
      Object

      The source object for the new link.

    • sourceProperty
      String
      String

      The property on the source object that identifies the target object of the new link.

    • target
      Object
      Object

      The child object involved in the new link that is to be initialized by calling this method. The target object must be a subtype of the type identified by the sourceProperty parameter. If target is set to null, the call represents a delete link operation.
